sentence.text: I did not know it was possible for foie gras to be tasteless , but the complete omission of seasoning certainly showed I was wrong .
If its research is successful , it should mean the end of mass-produced tomatoes that are tasteless because they are picked before they are fully ripe to prevent wastage during handling .
Serving melons However you serve them , always take melon out of the fridge half an hour before serving , or it will be very bland and tasteless .
There is a world of difference between ham that has been sliced from the bone or cut from a joint on a machine and the pre-packaged wet and tasteless substance that so many people believe to be ham .
Many of the most famous hams are British , which makes it all the more shameful that many shops are selling the wet and tasteless ersatz ham that we are all familiar with .
Well roasted coffee beans are always brown -- black beans are over roasted and will have a bitter flavour and insufficiently roasted beans are pale and give a colourless , tasteless drink .
Breakfast was a bowl of weak , milky coffee and a tasteless roll of bread .
Is it vital for us to eat meat daily , meat which is both costly and tasteless . "
Clean , pure and , arguably , tasteless , the Californian almonds are ready to be graded and shipped .
They tended to their horses and ate the flat , tasteless biscuits Thomas had brought with him before beginning their ride back .
She was a piano teacher ( most piano teachers give themselves the title Madam in South Wales ) , and the food was as tasteless as any I had encountered .
On a sunny wall I grew tomatoes and found that they need n't be , after all , red bags of tasteless liquid but firm and sweet and tasting of -- I could just remember it -- tomatoes .
Eating the cake , he had felt it like tasteless dough in his mouth , every mouthful an act of shared indecency .
Why is it that housewives still buy tasteless fruit from Common Market countries when English varieties are available , I suppose it boils down to cheapness .
Much of the factory food we eat is so tasteless that in desperation people reach for the brown sauce , tomato ketchup or pickles to perk it up .
Until quite recently , meat from lambs under two years old was considered pale and tasteless so mutton ( a darker meat ) was preferred , even though it required slower cooking .
In the palace , the castle , the country house , the wine would be good but the food tasteless , and the band given beer and sandwiches on the assumption that this would be their preference .
The food these children get is tasteless and un-nutritous .
